event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Iron Watch guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Iron Watch guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Iron Watch guard, you have no doubt caused them to dispatch reinforcements to track you down. Watch your step as you explore the sector.

event.name: REINFORCEMENTS_OG_IRON

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A Iron Watch ship moves in to attack! Based on the vengeful look in their captain's eye, this is no doubt the ship dispatched by the guard to hunt you down!

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_REINFORCEMENTS_OG_IRON

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: A Iron Watch ship moves in to attack! Based on the vengeful look in their captain's eye, this is no doubt the ship dispatched by the guard to hunt you down!

textList.name: TEXT_START_OG_IRON
textList.text: The Iron Watch are a collective of explorers, scientists, and pirates who ventured out into unexplored space. This is one of their rare settlements, now no longer so out of the way as it once was.
This somewhat isolated region was thrown into chaos at the start of the Rebellion. One of the rare homes of the Iron Watch, it's become far more populated in recent times.

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON
event.text: You are immediately 'greeted' by the guard. "Greetings friends! Welcome to our sector. I'm sure you're aware that there is a fee for entry..."

choice.text: We refuse to pay the fee, fight your way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The guard nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well. Security will let you through momentarily."

choice.text: Request a waver because of your mission.

event.text: "Very well. Good luck with your mission."

choice.text: (Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Control Weapon) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Mind Affecting Weapon) Induce chaos within the guard and slip past.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_WAVER_FAIL
event.text: "Why should I wave your fee? You are a Renegade, correct? If you are not aware, the Iron Watch is not beholden to Federation laws, and frankly having people like you here is a liability. We should be charging you more, not less."

choice.text: Then we'll fight our way through!

event.text: You mute the ship and prepare for combat.
The guard nods and combs over the scrap for a brief moment. "Very well. Security will let you through momentarily."

The guard scratches their face. "As you are likely aware, the Iron Watch is not beholden to Federation laws or jurisdiction. That said, I understand that your cause represents the best interests of everyone here. The Federation might not be our friend, but the Rebellion isn't either. I will do you this one favor, but do not expect everyone to be so generous."

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_CRIMINAL
event.text: Something seems off here. Usually, the Iron Watch wouldn't mind a ship like yours too much, but now, you catch suspicious chatter on the guard ship.
It seems your track record has caught up to you. The guard's crew have heard enough of the crimes you've been committing, and they don't intend to let you into the sector!

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_FRIENDLY
event.text: Good word has spread around, the guard immediately waves the usual entry fee and you're allowed in freely.
You now have some time to do something on the ship.

textList.name: TEXT_GUARD_OG_IRON_CONTACT
textList.text: "We acknowledge your hail. What is it that you seek friend?"
The Iron Watch captain accepts your hail, but does not speak a word.
A brief message is sent back to your ship in response. "We have received your request for communications. What is it you need friend?"

event.text: "And a fellow citizen of the Iron Watch? Take this gift of goodwill!"

choice.text: Change your mind and leave the guard alone.

event.text: You apologize and end comms. The guard makes no attempts to communicate further.
"I'm afraid we don't have much to spare, good luck on your mission friend."
"Of course we can help, take this as a gift of goodwill."

event.name: GUARD_OG_IRON_DEMAND
event.text: "That's no way to speak to an ally. I wish you luck on your mission but I suggest you stop trying to contact me."
The guard makes no attempt to respond to your threats, at least not verbally. Instead, they power up their weapons and move in to attack!
"There is no need for violence, friend. We will give you some supplies as you request, so long as you power down those weapons."

event.name: REPUTATION_UPDATE_OG_IRON
event.text: [REPUTATION INCREASED - IRON WATCH] You have done a good deed here in the eyes of the Iron Watch. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see positive support from the Iron Watch and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_UPDATE_OG_IRON_COMBAT
event.text: [REPUTATION INCREASED - IRON WATCH] You have done a good deed here in the eyes of the Iron Watch. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see positive support from the Iron Watch and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_OG_IRON
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED - IRON WATCH] Your actions here, justifiable or not, will not reflect well in the eyes of the Iron Watch or its citizens. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see negative reactions from the Iron Watch and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_OG_IRON_COMBAT
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED - IRON WATCH] Your actions here, justifiable or not, will not reflect well in the eyes of the Iron Watch or its citizens. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see negative reactions from the Iron Watch and its allies.

event.name: REPUTATION_DECREASE_DOUBLE_OG_IRON_COMBAT
event.text: [REPUTATION DECREASED X2 - IRON WATCH] Your actions here, justifiable or not, will not reflect well in the eyes of the Iron Watch or its citizens. Continuously perform actions like this and you might start to see negative reactions from the Iron Watch and its allies. For your extra egregious actions, your reputation was decreased twice.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_OG_IRON
textList.text: The Iron Watch captain lets out one final expletive as the ship is obliterated.
The hull of the Iron Watch vessel is dispersed out into space. You swoop in to salvage the remains.
The Iron Watch ship explodes, extinguishing all lives within. Your crew avoids their remains as they salvage the ship pieces.
One of the turrets is launched off into empty space as the ship explodes, throwing valuable debris in every direction.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_OG_IRON
textList.text: "Your bloodlust... will be your downfall someday, Renegade. You are only proof... the Federation... is no better than the Rebellion..."
Without a word, the Iron Watch captain falls to the ground, gasping for air as the life is extinguished from their eyes. You salvage the hull of their ship.
"You will regret this! Karma always comes back to people like you. Damn you Renegades... the Iron Watch would have been better off with the Rebellion..."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_OG_IRON
textList.text: "Alright, you win! Here's some equipment from our stores. Leave us alone!"
The ship repeatedly hails you. It looks like they want to surrender.
"You are considerably more well-armed than I would have thought. We surrender."
They send you a message: "Your ship is surprisingly well equipped! Please take this and let us live."
"Please don't kill us. We will give you everything we have!"
They offer you some of their cargo if you let them live.
They offer to give you some of their goods if you don't destroy their ship.
You get a frantic message, "Take everything we have. Just don't kill us!"
"You have clearly bested us. We merely request our lives."
"You have made your point, we are beaten. Take these and leave us to our shame."
"Take everything we have and let's both forget this happened."

event.name: ESCAPE_OG_IRON
event.text: Scans show that the Iron Watch ship is trying to escape. Destroy it before it can get away!

textList.name: TEXT_GOTAWAY_OG_IRON
textList.text: The Iron Watch vessel has slipped from your grasp, abandoning you at the beacon.
Your attempts at destroying the Iron Watch vessel have failed, and the ship has escaped.

event.name: GOTAWAY_OG_IRON_REMAINS
event.text: The Iron Watch vessel may have escaped, but not everything has gone wrong. A trail of scrap from the wreckage has been left behind, which you collect.

event.name: STOREEVENT_OG_IRON_TURRETS_STATION
event.text: The nearby market is overlooked by an allied refueling post.
You stock up on fuel then check out the store.
You stock up on fuel then check out the store.

choice.text: (Iron Watch Crew) Negotiate an even lower price.

event.text: You stock up on fuel then check out the store.
It's highly unlikely the market will want to trade with you after this, but that won't stop you from harassing random civilians.

event.name: OG_IRON_DEFENSE_DRONE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover an Iron Watch ship. The captain is seemingly quite distressed as you can hear yelling over the public channels. "What do you mean it's not a turret?" You can hear the faint noise of one of their crew trying to explain something the captain clearly doesn't understand. "So we were SCAMMED? That kniving merchant, ohhh if I see him again he's dead!"

Eventually the captain's angry reaches a crescendo and orders the would-be turret thrown out the airlock. "I want it out of sight, get us OUT OF HERE!" With that the Iron Watch ship jumps away. Now on you're on you have time to scoop up the "turret" and examine it yourself, it turns out it was just a simple defense drone.

choice.text: Avoid getting in the way of the angry captain.

event.text: You hide on the far side of a moon and hope the Iron Watch ship doesn't pick you up.

event.name: OG_IRON_FOR_SCIENCE
event.text: An Iron Watch vessel is advertising a temporary position to help in an experiment. They require an escort into the nearby asteroid field to test a modification to their turret.
You move in behind the Iron Watch ship and head into the asteroid field. "We're just calibrating the turret, it shouldn't take more than half a minute."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Time until the Iron Watch's turret is calibrated.

event.text: You avoid the Iron Watch ship and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_IRON_FOR_SCIENCE_ION_BLAST
event.text: "Come in, Come in, something has gone terribly wrong, our turrets have shut down."

choice.text: (Bonus Power Crew) Send your crewman to overcharge their systems.
(Backup Battery) Use your extra power to overcharge their systems.

event.name: OG_IRON_FOR_SCIENCE_PASS_ION
event.text: You manage to restore power to their turrets.

event.name: OG_IRON_FOR_SCIENCE_PASS
event.text: "We're finished, thanks for the help captain." The ship sends over some supplies in payment for your escort.

event.name: OG_IRON_FOR_SCIENCE_BLAST
event.text: You watch helplessly as a large asteroid rips through the Iron Watch ship. It fragments into a cloud of debris which quickly diffuse into the asteroid field, you're able to collect some of the wreckage before you leave.

event.name: OG_IRON_DAWN_WRECK
event.text: You've come across the wreck of a strange ship. It appears to be one the New Dawn ships you've heard of around here, a splinter group of the iron watch who appear to have allied with the rebellion.
The ship appears stripped bare, all but a few sections have anything salvageable. You collect whatever you can before returning to your own ship.
You avoid the ship and prepare for your next jump.

destroyed.text: The Iron Watch ship breaks apart. You hasten to contact the civilian ship.

deadCrew.text: No more life signs detected on the Iron Watch ship. You hasten to contact the civilian ship.

event.name: OG_IRON_CIVILIAN_PIRATE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover an Iron Watch ship in pursuit of a civilian, it appears the rules must be especially relaxed in this part of Iron Watch space for their own ships to be turning to piracy.
You power on your weapons and move in to attack.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range. After a time the distress calls stop.

event.name: OG_IRON_CIVILIAN_PIRATE_PULSAR
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover an Iron Watch ship in pursuit of a civilian, it appears the Iron Watch is taking advantage of the pulsar here to take advantage of civilians, although illegal in most areas of iron watch space it appears this ship isn't worried about being caught.
You power on your weapons and move in to attack.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range. After a time the distress calls stop.

event.name: OG_IRON_DAWN_SETUP
event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover one of those strange New Dawn ships attacking a civilian, it doesn't appear that they've noticed you yet.
The civilian ship explodes before you're able to do anything, the New Dawn vessel notices you and turns to run, within a moment they've jumped away.

choice.text: Loot the remains of the civilian vessel.

event.text: You move in and begin looting the civilian when an Iron Watch ship arrives at the beacon. They appear to think you're responsible for the wreck as they immediately move in to attack.

choice.text: Report the attack via a nearby Iron Watch outpost.

event.text: You contact the local Iron Watch authorities and let them know about the attack, a short while later an Iron Watch ship arrives. "I'm sorry you had to see that captain, these attacks are getting worse and worse every day. I have these supplies here to be given to those attacked, but it doesn't look they'll be needing them, why don't you take them instead."
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range. After a time the distress calls stop.

surrender.text: Please, you can have the wreck, just let us live!

event.name: OG_IRON_EXPLORE_TRANSPORT_SECURE
event.text: You scrap the wreck and collect what you can from it's stores before preparing for your next jump

event.name: OG_IRON_EXPLORE_TRANSPORT
event.text: You're greeted by an Iron Watch ship, "Hello Captain, I don't suppose you've seen a ship wreck out here somewhere. Apparently a New Dawn transport was seen heading into this asteroid field after being hit by a nearby anti-ship battery. We believe they may have been wrecked around here somewhere."

choice.text: Help them search for the transport.
(Upg. Sensors) Perform a scan of the area.
(Adv. Sensors) Perform a deep scan of the asteroid field.

event.text: The Iron Watch ship eventually disapears from view as it searches the asteroid field.

event.name: OG_IRON_EXPLORE_TRANSPORT_FIND
event.text: You eventually pickup the odd transport, it appears to be punctured by several asteroids. You begin searching the vessel and find a pristine weapon onboard, a few moments later the Iron Watch vessel appears, "Oh good you found it, thanks for the help guys, we'll take it from here."

choice.text: Attack the ship to claim the wreck for yourself.

event.text: As you power on your weapons the Iron Watch vessel seems to notice what your doing, their captain sputters out a few explitives but turns on her own weapons in response.
The wreck eventually drifts out of view.

event.name: OG_IRON_EXPLORE_TRANSPORT_FIND_LATE
event.text: Eventually you find the wreck, and as it happens the Iron Watch vessel. It appears they've already been scrapping the wreck for some time. "Oh good you're still alive, we appreciate the help but we don't need anything else, good luck with your mission."

choice.text: Attack the ship to claim the wreck for yourself.

event.text: As you power on your weapons the Iron Watch vessel seems to notice what your doing, their captain sputters out a few explitives but turns on her own weapons in response.
The wreck eventually drifts out of view.
You search the asteroid field for what feels like hours, but can't find anything. You did stumble across what appears to be a cargo container with some basic supplies in it however.

event.name: OG_IRON_DISTRESS_WATCH
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to find a heavily damage Iron Watch ship locked in battle with a pirate, without help the Iron Watch ship won't last very long.
You power on your weapons, the pirate vessel, sensing the greater threat, turns it's attention to you.
The fight brings them out of your immediate scanning range. After a time the distress calls stop.

event.name: OG_IRON_DISTRESS_WATCH_PIRATE_DEAD
event.text: The Iron Watch has partially recovered from the fight earlier, they thank you for rescuing them.

choice.text: Capitalize on the damage and attack them.

event.text: The crew of the Iron Watch look in horror as you power up your weapons and prepare to attack them.
"Of course, take these as thanks."

event.name: OG_IRON_DISTRESS_PULSAR
event.text: The civilian vessel here appears stranded by the pulsar. "Captain, thank goodness you're here, our jump drives were taken out when the pulsar hit as just as we were executing a jump, the power spike fried the engines. We're low on supplies and don't have a dedicated engineer onboard, any help would be appreciated."
"Thanks for the help, hopefully we'll be able to get this fixed quickly."

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) See if your engineer can help.

event.text: Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. Eventually, they're able to get to the root of the problem, much to the Captains's delight. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."
You need all the scrap you can get, and this ship will be an easy target.

choice.text: Apologize and say you can't help.

event.text: The Captain of the ship sighs. "Send someone our way if you can."
Your drone begins to tinker with the broken jump drive. Before too long, the drone identifies the problem and the drive comes to life. "All systems are nominal... Great! Thanks for the help."

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken jump drive. It returns a report saying that there is insufficient resources to repair, but prints a readout of how it could be repaired. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what we need." They give you a small reward.

Your drone begins to tinker with the broken jump drive. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. The drone prints a readout of the problems that it identified but couldn't fix. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. Eventually, they're able to get to the root of the problem, much to the Captains's delight. "All systems are nominal... Great! It should come back on once we jump. Thanks for the help."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. While they don't get it working, they manage to diagnose it. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Now we know what's wrong." They give you a small reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. It momentarily comes to life, then pops. Seems like they only got it partially working. "Well, I guess it's better than nothing... Maybe we can make do with this for now." They give you a modest reward.

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. As one of your crew adjusts something, the drive pops and burns before catching fire. Seems like you completely broke it. "Way to go, jackass. Now we're completely screwed."

Your crew take some time experimenting and working with the faulty jump drive. Try as they might, they have absolutely no idea what's wrong with it. The Crew shake their heads. "How did you think you would know what was wrong if we couldn't figure it out...?"

event.name: OG_IRON_DELIVERY
event.text: You've arrived face to face with an Iron Watch transport, your sensors are able to detect their jump drive being charged.
As they execute the jump, you watch an undefended asteroid slam into the side of the ship, tearing a section free. This doesn't impede the jump and the transport disappears a moment later.

Most of the wreckage is useless, but you do eventually find a cargo container, and inside an unusual looking turret. It appears that this turret had a specific destination, an outpost nearby. You note down the cooridinates.

event.name: OG_IRON_DELIVERY_OUTPOST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The intended destination of the turret you found.

event.text: This beacon is home to a large outpost, several ships can be seen in and around the outpost. You spot the damaged transport nearby.

You exit your ship and immediately overhear the loud conversation happening nearby "I don't know what we're going to do, they're going to take away my ship over this. Why did we ever go into that asteroid field, it didn't even save us more than like 1 jump."

"Oh thank goodness, how in the multiverse did you find it?" You explain that you saw them get hit and lose it. "You're a lifesaver, here take these supplies as a reward." With the turret in tow, the captain of the transport heads off into the outpost.

choice.text: You don't have the missing turret with you.

event.text: You prepare for your next jump.

choice.text: You can dock at the outpost but without crew it will be hard to do anything there.

event.text: You prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_IRON_DAWN_HIDEOUT
event.text: You arrive at the beacon face to face with a New Dawn scout. You immediately detect the ship powering up it's jump drive, you only have a moment before they jump away.

choice.text: Attempt to fire on their jump drive!

event.text: The ship doesn't immediately jump away, it appears you have their attention. You explain that you're not going to kill them, you just want to know what they're doing here. They don't immediately respond and they keep their jump drive ready.

Eventually they respond, "Renegade, if you want to know anything you're going to have to prove yourself to us. Theres a nearby Iron Watch supply depot, go there and take it out, then we'll talk." With that they jump away.
The ship immediately shuts off their comms, a moment later they're gone. It appears that they have no interest in hearing you out, perhaps if they had heard of you they'd be more willing to listen.
The ship jumps away, you prepare for your next jump.
The New Dawn scout easily dodges your attack, a moment later they've jumped away.
You score a direct hit on their engines, disabling their jump drive.

event.name: OG_IRON_DAWN_HIDEOUT_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of the Iron Watch supply depot you've been tasked with destroying by the New Dawn.

event.text: You've arrived at beacon to find the Iron Watch supply depot, unfortunately it's not alone, an Iron Watch ship stands on guard nearby.
The Iron Watch vessel quickly moves in between you and the depot, prepare to fight.
The Iron Watch are very grateful for the warning and they offer some supplies as thanks.
You keep your distance and prepare for your next jump.

event.name: OG_IRON_DAWN_HIDEOUT_QUEST_WIN
event.text: With the guard ship dealt with you're able to access and loot and destroy the depot. It appears that the New Dawn were watching because it isn't very long before you receive a message. "Find us at the New Dawn forward operating base, we'll talk there."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_OG_IRON
textList.text: As you jump into the system a rogue Iron Watch ship advances on your position. They are refusing all hails. Prepare for a fight.
Soon after arriving in the system you are hailed by a small cruiser. "What good fortune that we happen to run into each other. Nothing personal, but you have some information we need!"
The only other ship at this beacon messages you: "Finally, after months of waiting, someone has fallen into our trap!"
You barely have time to register jump completion before your ship warns you of an incoming ship with weapons hot.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_OG_IRON_PULSAR
event.text: This beacon has been placed too close to a neutron star! The radiation field will temporarily ionize your systems. Iron Watch ships have apparently been designed to remain quite effective in the presence of pulsars, you're in for a bad time.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_OG_PIRATE_PULSAR
event.text: This beacon has been placed too close to a neutron star! The radiation field will temporarily ionize your systems. A pirate, apparently oblivious to the danger of the pulsar, moves in to engage.
